page.title: 04Dr.C.Irwin's Day
page.content: The day begins at the stroke of mid- night.It is the first of the night calls. I put on my clothes,including a polo neck sweater.I admit a holiday maker to hospital with chest pains. The next call is at 2.00 a.m.:an allergic reaction to penicillin.I go back to bed at 3.00 a.m. I'm woken again at 7.00 and called to the nearby village of Broadmayne. Morning surgery begins at 8.45 a.m. I see about twelve people, taking from five minutes up to thirty minutes each After surgery there are visits to homes. Sometimes a visit could take most of the day...babies being born at home :or if someone very ill is going to die,I go back several times during the day.This is not the most busy time I remember.
